overview: Introduction to recent developments in macroeconomics. Students will learn how to formulate and solve stochastic dynamic economic models and to apply these techniques to a number of substantive issues in consumption, asset pricing, business cycle theory, monetary economics, and labour economics.
ilo: Formulate dynamic macroeconomic models that could provide answers to well posed questions;
Apply existing empirical work to parameterize and calibrate such models and understand some methods of estimation;
Evaluate critically the performance of such models;
Develop an understanding of representative agent models and/or heterogeneous agent models;
Analyse the interplay of questions, theory, and data.
generic_skills: Evaluation of ideas, views and evidence;
Synthesis of ideas, views and evidence;
Application of theory to economic policy and business decision making;

Prerequisites.content: Admission into or selection of one of the following:

content: BH-COM Bachelor of Commerce (Degree with Honours)
Economics specialisation (formal) in the BH-ARTS Bachelor of Arts (Degree with Honours)
